message:
Regarding the new whatsapp p2p encryption update  
I noticed many people share screenshots of their whatsapp conversations keys on public. Is that ok ? 

I cant read the whole documentation now but the keys these code represent seems to be public in nature but and whatsapp even offer the option to share it but i cant shake the feeling this is a bad practice specially that i cant find an option tha allow pairs to regenerate their keys

data.message: I got the goosebumps as well, but I think it is meant to be shared.
AFAIK,, this key is useless unless you have the other one
Most probably it is the public key, and in this case it is supposed to be shared

Anything sent to you will be encrypted using your public key, and can only be decrypted using your private key.

Anything you send will be encrypted using your private key, and can't be decrypted without your public key.
Remember that these keys are used for validation. I am sure someone will come up with a validation attack that abuse these keys

What's your problem with keys being shared ?. They were made to be shared.

Try to re-install whatsapp and diff the keys

Check signal/open whisper github repos
